title: CALB signs MoU for factory in Portugal
notes:
Location:
- Portugal, at the port of Sines

Capacity:
- The first phase of the battery cell factory will have an annual capacity of 15 GWh, with plans to triple production to 45 GWh by 2028.

Investment amounts:
- N/A

Project progress:
- CALB has signed a non-binding letter of intent with a subsidiary of the Portuguese Agency for Investment and Foreign Trade (AICEP). The first phase of the battery cell factory is planned to go into operation at the end of 2025, with the aim for CALB batteries to be installed in European cars by the end of the first quarter of 2026. A possible third expansion phase is already being considered.

Project type:
- New build

Value chain stages:
- 1) Cathode and anode manufacturing
- 2) Cell fabrication
- 3) Module assembly

title: CALB starts process for lithium battery unit in Sines
notes:
Location:
- The lithium battery factory for electric cars will be located in the Industrial and Logistics Zone of Sines (ZILS), in the district of Setúbal, Portugal.

Capacity:
- The production unit is expected to have a capacity of 15 GWh, to be built on an area of about 50 hectares within the 100-hectare land identified for the factory.

Investment amounts:
- The company has not disclosed specific investment amounts, but it has signed a memorandum of understanding with a subsidiary of the Agency for Investment and Foreign Trade of Portugal (AICEP) for the acquisition of surface rights to set up the factory.

Project progress:
- The environmental licensing process for the construction project of the Lithium Battery Unit has already started, and a Proposal for Definition of Scope (PDA) of the Environmental Impact Study (EIA) has been presented to the Portuguese Environment Agency (APA). The public consultation for the EIA is ongoing until a specified date.

Project type:
- The project is a new build, aiming to construct and operate a lithium battery production unit.

Value chain stages:
- N/A

title: Mega Chinese lithium battery factory in Sines at risk
notes:
Location:
- The battery factory project is planned to be located in Sines, Portugal, within the Sines Industrial and Logistics Zone.

Capacity:
- The planned capacity of the factory is 15GWh, with production scheduled to begin in 2025. It is expected to reach full capacity at cruising speed between 2028 and 2030, representing around 4% of Portuguese GDP.

Investment amounts:
- The project has entered the environmental licensing process and a contract was signed to reserve surface rights over 92 hectares in the Sines Industrial and Logistics Zone. However, there is no specific information available about the capital invested or any subsidies received for the project.

Project progress:
- A memorandum of understanding for construction of the plant was signed in November. However, there have been no significant developments in the partnerships that CALB appears to have formalized with Portugal. The project remains "active" according to AICEP, but there are uncertainties about its progress due to issues faced by the CALB group in China and the lack of response from the group.

Project type:
- The project is a new build, described as a "world-leading, highly intelligent, computerized and automated factory, with zero carbon emissions."

Value chain stages:
- The project is expected to cover the stages of cell fabrication, with the factory being a lithium battery production facility.

Note: The project's progress and future are uncertain due to issues faced by the CALB group in China and potential implications of the decision to remove Huawei from national 5G networks.
